sentences: Küsi mult abi, kui sul on mure.
Ma küsisin temalt, mis kell on.
context: The Estonian word 'küsi' means 'to ask'. It is the imperative form (command) of the verb küsima. In the first sentence it's used in imperative to tell someone to ask for help, in the second as past tense küsisin meaning 'I asked', and in the third with negation ei pea meaning 'you don't need to ask'.
